title: To ensure continuity for the design of the 5-cent coin, establish the Coin Design Advisory Committee, and for other purposes.
content: American 5-Cent Coin Design Continuity Act of 2002 - Authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury to change the design on the obverse and the reverse of the 5-cent coin for coins issued in 2003 and 2004 in commemoration of the bicentennial of the Louisiana Purchase. Amends Federal law governing coins and currency to mandate that: (1) the obverse of any 5-cent coin issued after December 31, 2004, bear an image of Thomas Jefferson. And (2) the reverse of any such coin bear an image of the home of Thomas Jefferson at Monticello. Establishes the Coin Design Advisory Committee to advise the Secretary on: (1) design proposals relating to circulating coinage and numismatic items, including congressional gold medals. And (2) any other issues relating to items produced by the US Mint that the Secretary may request.
